Space Systems Command struggles with implementing Zero Trust Architecture as mandated by OMB M-22-09, requiring specialized cybersecurity solutions to secure critical space infrastructure and meet compliance deadlines by 2024.

Per GAO findings on Strategic Human Capital Management, Space Systems Command faces workforce gaps in IT and engineering talent, needing contractor support for recruitment, training, and retention strategies to build a skilled cadre for space technology development.

Under Executive Order on AI, Space Systems Command must establish AI governance frameworks by 2025, requiring contractor expertise in developing AI policies and integration strategies for space mission planning and threat detection.

Census Bureau struggles with operational planning for the Decennial Census, as GAO reports highlight recurring cost overruns, with the 2020 Census costing $15.6 billion against initial estimates of $12.5 billion, creating a need for contractors with expertise in cost estimation and risk management tools.

GAO and IG findings note persistent workforce challenges in recruiting and retaining skilled enumerators for field data collection, particularly in hard-to-count areas, requiring contractors to provide scalable training programs and temporary staffing solutions.

Per OMB M-22-09, the Census Bureau must implement Zero Trust Architecture by 2024, but faces gaps in identity management and network segmentation, opening opportunities for contractors offering compliant cybersecurity solutions and integration services.

IG reports identify ongoing issues with data quality assurance in non-decennial surveys like the Current Population Survey, necessitating contractor support for advanced statistical analysis tools and automated data validation processes.
